block.p: 1. Glue joining the blue and white pieces after two earlier breakages has become yellow and extremely brittle. Restorers at the British Museum in London will break and reassemble the vase, using modern techniques and materials.
2. The choice of delegates apparently leaves Mr. Gorbachev without the major infusion of new faces he hoped would help generate support for his programs.
3. The ruling will enable each defendant to make use of the testimony his co-defendants gave to a Congressional hearing under immunity.

4. Dave Bresnahan, a former reserve catcher for the Williamsport Bills, a team in the Cleveland Indians' organization, substituted a potato for a baseball in a fake pickoff attempt in a game last season.
5. President Duarte sought to unify his ruling party and calm extremists in the army and opposition groups before leaving to be treated for cancer in the United States.
6. More complex mathematical tasks that are increasingly sought by employers.
7. The number of commercials in children's television programs.
8. Mayor Hassan al-Tawil of El Bireh in the occupied West Bank defied warnings to Israei-appointed municipal officials that they resign or face revenge from Palestinian ''hit teams.''

9. Macrophages are a type of immune system cell undetectable by currently used screening. The finding suggests that the AIDS virus may be carried by people who have been tested and declared free of the disease.

10. Governor Cuomo and Richard Celeste of Ohio agreed on a joint proposal to reduce acid rain that would require Federal legislation for steep national reductions in pollution from coal-burning power plants and other industrial sources over the next 25 years.
11. He wore the glove to avoid soiling his hand by shaking with ''Arab traitors.''
12. Because of the library's success in raising funds, the National Endowment for the Humanities has drastically reduced its 1989 financing for the activities of the research libraries.
13. That Mr. Dukakis had distorted the state of the national economy.
14. The appointment of Hojatolislam Hashemi Rafsanjari, the Speaker of Iran's Parliament, as commander of the armed forces, a position previously held by Ayatollah Khomeini.
